text: How about we simplify it and build it in a global module then pull it into your footer?
Lets use a module and we will use a simple menu.
Then create a title property and group them together.
Then we create a for loop and grab the title and inside the for loop we need to iterate (dig down) into the menu because it is an array of objects that we need to access such as the link attribute.

`<div>`
  `{% for column in module.columns %}`
  `<div class="column1-title">`
    `<p>{{ column.title }}</p>`
    `<ul>`
      `{% for item in <http://column.menu|column.menu> %}`
      `<li>`
        `<span style="font-size: 14px; font-weight: 600;"><a href="{{ item.url }}">{{ item.linkLabel }}</a></span>`
      `</li>`
      `{% endfor %}`
    `</ul>`
  `</div>`
  `{% endfor %}`
`</div>`
Incase you didn't know you can highlight the code and press shift tab and it will auto format the code.
You should now have something like this ready to format
Then pull it into the partial. Make sure and change the module name and path in the code.
Hey! Thanks so much the was helpful in getting me going on this.
